And when I ABSOLUTELY have to use this for life and death situations… my noob PC inside JVM

            - Windows XP Pro SP3 (Modified) Only use for windows applications for work really...

item.title: Post your Desktop (Gnome, Xfce, Enlightenment, *Box, pekwm, ect...)
item.dc:creator: @Dzo -Dzo-
item.description:
@Dzo wrote:

^^ Oo tint2? Looks nice. Gotta love the crunchbang setup. Looks like your doing it with Arch in that screenie?

Yea. I’m a design freak Sorry if any of that first post was illogical since I was tripping, drunk and high when I composed it D: Haha, I’m not sure why, I always have a strong urge to post on mopar when shit like that goes down.

I’m truly surprised there isn’t a Desktop Enviroment thread tho. There has to be more people interested in desktop design on mopar then just myself, right? I actually hear you can do some pretty cool stuff with windows these days too (graphically). Never was worth it in my opinion though, when you can just install distros with Enlightenment and such.

EDIT: DockbarX is actually a lot like the Windows 7 bar. Its not that it was trying to copy it, its just that it really is a good idea. On hover you just get a transparent list of the type of window (chrome in this case) that is currently open.

Taken from DockBarX

Q: Why do you want to make Linux into a Microsoft Windows 7 clone? A: I don't. The goal of DockbarX isn't to be a clone of the Windows 7 task bar. Windows 7 task bar has a good principle, though. When it comes to your most used programs it's more productive to do all window handling - launching, selecting, closing, etc. from the same few pixels. If I need a Firefox window I move my mouse cursor to the same spot on the screen regardless of which Firefox window I want and or if I even have opened a Firefox window yet. This behavior is good and it would be stupid not to implement it just because "Windows had it first". Don't reduce your productivity out of stubbornness. When it comes to looks it's up to you to choose a theme that looks like windows 7 or a theme that doesn't look that way.

-Dzo

Read full topic
